title: 2 SIMPLE & EASY KDP Niche Research Methods: Niches Are EVERYWHERE!

tactics.name: Google Lists + Amazon Check
tactics.description: Use Google to find niche lists (animals, sports, etc.) and verify demand via Amazon search and KDP extension analysis
steps: Search Google for niche lists (e.g., 'list of animals')
Use Amazon to check book performance metrics
Apply KDP niche research extension for BSR analysis
caveats: Micro-niches with high BSR may have low demand

tactics.name: Amazon + Google Niche Hunt
tactics.description: Use Amazon and Google to identify niches by analyzing product listings and related keywords.
steps: Check author central profiles for related niches
Use SPT Chrome extension to evaluate keyword profitability
caveats: Requires time to manually verify profitability
source_quotes: the more keywords there are it means that those keywords those niches gets a lot of traffic

tactics.name: Author Central Analysis
tactics.description: Explore Amazon Author Central to uncover related authors and niche clusters.
steps: Filter Amazon books by author central presence
Extract niche keywords from book titles
Cross-reference with SPT Chrome extension scores
caveats: May miss niche variations in non-English markets
source_quotes: why do we need this author central well it's quite important because now when someone has an author central we can see all related authors
